# Contributing

This project is open source, which means you can contribute to it's success and further development. Please use the following process when contributing, and remember to abide the [Code Of Conduct](CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md). You can also support the project by reporting issues on our issue page, or contacting any lead developer for security related issues.

## Pull Request Process

1. Fork the project, this creates your own version you can work on. Only Lead/Core Developers can contribute directly to this code-base. 
2. Make the changes to the project, please check the checklist below to ensure that you've done everything needed.
3. Submit a pull request for your new version back to this codebase. 
4. Repeat Steps 2 & 3 for any different issues you want to tackle or until your pull request is accepted.
5. Add yourself as a contributor! ([See Below](#Adding-Yourself-As-A-Contributor))

## Recomendations

If you would like to work on multiple issues at the same time, or while waiting for pull request approval, you can use branches to track the different versions. This would let you easily work on different parts of the project for pull requests.

## Pre-Pull Request Checklist

 - [ ] Ensure that you have updated any documentation related to things you have changed.
 - [ ] Ensure that any current tests pass
 - [ ] Write new tests for the parts you have changed to test that they work correctly.

 ## Adding Yourself As A Contributor

 [![All Contributors](https://img.shields.io/badge/%20-All%20Contributors-brightgreen?color=B1ABEA&labelColor=2D2298&style=flat-square&logo=data:image/png;base64,)](https://allcontributors.org/)

 This project follows the [All Contributors](https://allcontributors.org/) specification. Contributions of any kind are welcome!

 To add yourself as a contributor, go to our stickied issue 'Add Contributors' and comment the following:

 ```
 @all-controbutors add <username> for <contribution>
 ```

 Alternatively, you can use the sme comment in an issue or pull request you helped with.

 ### Supported Contribution Types
 The [Emoji Key](https://allcontributors.org/docs/en/emoji-key) âœ¨ (and Contribution Types) can be found on [allcontributors.org](https://allcontributors.org)
